PerformanceNavigationTimingDomInteractiv.summary: The domInteractive read-only property returns a representing the time immediately before the user agent sets the document's readyState to "interactive".

blockquote.para: Note: This property is not Time to interactive (TTI). This property refers to the time when DOM construction is finished and interaction to it from JavaScript is possible. See also the interactive state of which corresponds to this property.

remarks.para: Measuring DOM processing time may not be consequential unless your site has a very large HTML source to a construct a Document Object Model from.
If there is no parser-blocking JavaScript then the DOMContentLoaded event (see domContentLoadedEventStart for the timestamp) will fire immediately after domInteractive.

PerformanceNavigationTimingDomInteractiv.value: A representing the time immediately before the user agent sets the document's readyState to "interactive".
